entry.title: Update form managers from server predictions.
entry.content:
Dynamic changes to a password form can cause its content and form

signature to change. However, PWM does currently not handle the

following flow of events correctly:



1) Form gets recognized (and potentially filled) by PWM, say because

it is a login form.

2) The page then destroys the password element. This changes the form's

signature and new server predictions are requested.

3) The server predictions for the resulting form (same renderer id, but

different signature) arrive from Autofill.

4) PasswordManager::ProcessAutofillPredictions() finds that there is

already a PasswordFormManager (because look-up happens via renderer

id) and therefore performs no update.



The correct behaviour in 4) would be to update the password form

manager if the observed form has changed and trigger filling.



This CL makes that change. It uses the same call paths (and thus

criteria) as dynamic form updates reported by the renderer side and

processed inside of CreateFormManagers.



Bug: 1465803

Change-Id: I54a71eda410520f9fd8f63fc8e7a0f7d50e3a35d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720535

Reviewed-by: Maria Kazinova

Reviewed-by: Vasilii Sukhanov

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

entry.content:
Fix operator new resolution failures in:

- third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/construct_traits.h

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Add round trip after ui_controls.request_processed
entry.content:
The Wayland base protocol does not map cleanly onto ui_controls

semantics. After the compositor emits ui_controls.request_processed, we

need to wait for a Wayland round-trip to ensure that all side-effects

(most importantly, all pending configure events) have been processed.

See https://crbug.com/1336706#c11 and https://crbug.com/1443374#c3 for

details.



Bug: 1443374

entry.title: Do not keep reference to PopupBaseView in PopupBaseView::Widget.
entry.content:
The PopupBaseView::Widget class sets the PopupBaseView as its delegate

and keeps a raw pointer to it. However, prior to its own destruction,

Widget tells its own delegate to destroy itself. This leaves the

raw pointer inside PopupBaseView::Widget dangling.



This CL removes this member and replaces it by casting the

WidgetDelegate* (which is always known to be a PopupBaseView) to

PopupBaseView* instead.



Bug: 1467748, 1419832

Change-Id: I6a8cbd41c3b6a32462d10762ddd5a98ee6316afd

entry.title: [PA] Make base a public_deps of c/embedder_support/origin_trials
entry.content:
The public interface of this target do include several headers from

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.



See GN doc explaining this:

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

not going to be able to stand alone completely. Its public_config is not

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

fail to compile the "test_support" dependant.

entry.title: Make mojo and DB supports other fields in URLPattern.
entry.content:
This CL adds support on all other URLPattern fields to make it usable in

matching in the browser side process. Also, this CL adds the

URLPatternOptions field so that some options set in `URLPattern`

constructor can be passed. Especially, the ignore_case option has been

supported.



Also, we noticed that the empty field in the URLPattern means

the pattern should not match the URL with the field.

e.g. URLPattern({search:""}) should not match the URL with a search

string.

Database automatically absorb the difference by setting full wildcard

pattern to the fields other than pathname if the legacy pathname is

used.



Note that ServiceWorkerRouterEvaluator implementation and IDL

implementation will come in the other CLs later.



Minor change:

- renamed function and variable names in SW DB because we now handle not

only pathnames but also other fields.



Bug: 1371756, 1467845

Change-Id: Ia94d8db9efe1ec37f2c34400a34dc239467d7ad2

entry.title: Wait for load event in undo-redo.html
entry.content:
This test expects navigation by modifying srcdoc to be synchronous, but

it's not, causing the test to continue before the navigation finishes,

which is exacerbated if the navigation changes LocalFrame due to

RenderDocument.



This CL makes this test wait for the load event to make it not flaky.



Bug: 936696

entry.title: Maintain operator precedence for rewritten unaryOperatorExpressions
entry.content:
Before this change, an expression like o.member++ was rewritten into

*o.member++ where member has type int&.



operators (++ and --) have higher precedence over operator*. This means

that the expression should rather be rewritten into (*o.member)++ to

conserve previous behaviour.



Change-Id: I23f6a0e5692b0a9f319a42be5b383e466c7b2b1e

entry.title: reland: CCA: Make bundled CCA work under subpath
entry.content:
Currently the output of `cca.py bundle` doesn't work when not served

under root of a domain, since there's many reference of URL that start

with '/'.



To solve this, rewrite all URL pattern in HTML/CSS files to relative

path, and change the path to include subpath in runtime for JS files.

Test: `cca.py dev` and open with local chrome.

Test: `cca.py bundle` and serve with static http server under subpath

resumes from suspension.

entry.title: [PA] Fix PartitionAllocThreadCacheTest.ThreadCacheRegistry and MultipleThreadCachesAccounting on Android, Linux and ChromeOS with PA-E enabled.
entry.content:
Regarding https://luci-analysis.appspot.com, the following 4 tests

are flaky on Android bots:

PartitionAllocThreadCacheTest.MultipleThreadCachesAccounting/1

PartitionAllocThreadCacheTest.ThreadCacheRegistry/1

PartitionAllocThreadCacheTest.ThreadCacheRegistry/0

PartitionAllocThreadCacheTest.MultipleThreadCachesAccounting/0



Looking at the test failures, the issue was caused by non-joinable

thread created at InotifyReader::StartThread() by

FilePathWatcherTest. Since the InotifyReader is used on Linux,

ChromeOS and Android platforms (c.f. base/BUILD.gn), the failures

are also reproducable on Linux and ChromeOS.

So disable the expectations too on Android, Linux and ChromeOS with

PA-E enabled.



Bug: 1393636, 1393631

Change-Id: I9e52f8c58986af8eb696cd2df958dc5dc302477a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4721356

entry.title: Browser to ignore global geo switch if PH off
entry.content:
Browser should ignore the cros global geolocation switch if the

PrivacyHub feature is off. If it does not, users may find themselves in

a state where the geolocation is disabled and they have no easy way to

re-enable it.



This patch implements this fully in Ash.

For Lacros we disable the geolocation switch in browser entirely to fix

the user facing problem.

This is not a problem, because geolocation is planned only for a future

version of PrivacyHub, so if it stops working on Lacros, this will not

affect users (unless they use the experimental flag).

A proper fix will be implemented as a change to crosapi later.



BUG=b/293398125

BUG=1464302



Change-Id: I71b3b7756d05cbed7022acb827f797ed64d24345

entry.title: URL: Measure escaped ASCII chars in URL path
entry.content:
Chrome currently unescapes percent-encoded ASCII characters in URL

path. However, this behavior is non-compliant with the URL Standard.



To address this interoperability issue, we need to assess the impact

of fixing it.



I worried about measuring being a hotspot since this can happen when

constructing a GURL or KURL. However, we added a similar UMA for URL

host part [1] in the past. So most likely this will be OK.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/3152695

entry.title: [Reland] WebUI: Include all WebUIMochaBrowserTest tests on Windows cross builds.
entry.content:
Reland notes: Orginal CL had incorrect logic when populating

include_js2gtest_tests, which is fixed here.



Previously all WebUI tests were not included in Windows cross builds,

because js2gtest was not compatible with such builds

(crbug.com/1010561). Newer WebUI tests no longer use js2gtest and

therefore can be successfully built on cross builds.



Splitting include_js_tests flag to two separate flags

- include_js_tests

- include_js2gtest_tests



to allow differentiating between old and new tests, and hooking it up

to the chrome/test/data/webui:{browser_tests,interactive_ui_tests}

targets.



Bug: 1010561,1457360

entry.title: Default Apps: Support stylus capability check on Lacros
entry.content:
The Cursive app preload on ChromeOS is currently restricted to devices

with stylus-enabled touchscreens. This restriction is implemented by

checking ui::DeviceDataManager to determine what touchscreens are

available.



On Lacros, ui::DeviceDataManager is populated by Wayland, and does not

have the full information needed to implement this check. Instead, we

perform the check on Ash side and pass it through DeviceProperties on

crosapi (which already has similar values for other preload properties).



As DeviceDataManager is populated asynchronously, there is a chance that

it might not be ready by the time Lacros starts. I have never seen this

happen in local testing, but we already have UMA in place to detect if

this happens. We could adjust behavior on the Lacros side to not modify

the current preload state if stylus capability is unknown.



In the medium-to-long term, we hope to remove the stylus-only

restriction on the Cursive preload, which would remove the need for this

crosapi parameter.



Bug: 1360294

entry.title: WebNN: Define GraphImpl and its CreateAndBuild() method for DML backend
entry.content:
This CL defines the GraphImpl which inherits WebNNGraphImpl to

represent a DML graph implementation. And GraphImpl::CreateAndBuild()

method is defined for building and compiling a DML graph via

GraphBuilder, then initializing the graph. The GraphImpl instance will

only be created and bound to the mojom::WebNNGraph receiver in

GraphImpl::OnWaitForBuildSignal method. Also define some methods like

CreateInputNode and CreateOperatorNodeForRelu to convert the mojo graph

struct to corresponding DML graph node.



To validate the correctness of GraphImpl::CreateAndBuild() method,

WebNNGraphDMLImplTest is added. For resuing the codes of building

mojom::GraphInfoPtr, GraphInfoBuilder is defined in webnn_test_utils.h

and webnn_test_utils.cc files.



Bug: 1273291

entry.title: [zlib][build] Adding option to build with Rabin-Karp hash
entry.content:
Canonical zlib uses a division hash that is a variation of

Rabin-Karp for compression.



We have a bitstream compatibility mode where generated compressed

results will match with canonical zlib, by passing a define

(i.e. USE_ZLIB_RABIN_KARP_ROLLING_HASH).



This change adds an option to allow users to build chromium

zlib with the compatibility mode enabled.



Bug: 1381000

entry.content:

detect if the app has been backgrounded or not. To prevent the

reoccurence of removing the observer, we move these observers to the

service instead of the TabHelper.

entry.title: Address CmdLineURLRestartTest flakiness
entry.content:
The test was failing intermittently due to an incorrect UseCounter

count. This change updates the way UseCounters are synchronized.

Previously this code relied on calling Navigate to ensure UseCounters

were flushed.



Instead, we now use content::FetchHistogramsFromChildProcesses and

metrics::SubprocessMetricsProvider::MergeHistogramDeltasForTesting.

These functions ensure that base::HistogramTester sees histograms/metrics for all subprocesses. These functions require that there is no race between the call to FetchHistogramsFromChildProcesses

and the child process shutting down. To ensure this doesn't happen, we make sure we read these values in a loop, similar to other usages of

these functions.



Bug: 1448030

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

entry.title: [ios] Merge //base/ios into //base
entry.content:
The target //base/ios was separate because it contained file that

required ARC to be enabled but //base could not enable it because

it also listed some Objective-C++ file that would not compile if

ARC was enabled.



With recent changes that converted all Objective-C++ code in the

codebase to require ARC, this distinction is no longer needed. It

become problematic to have two separate targets because developer

put direct dependencies on //base/ios instead of //base (incorrect)

which causes dependencies issue in some case.

entry.title: Reland "[VC] ukm logging for arc++ apps."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a3ab73187fdf1bb0fa65df9cfa28d56259f6dce8



Suprisingly the best fix for now is to just remove the duration check.



The issue happened because if the duration is less than 10ms, it is

bucketized into 0 by UKM.

The proper fix would be make the delay longer.



I have considered these options.

(1) change the test into an unit test and use BrowserTaskEnvironment;

this can't be done easily because the whole class heavily depends on

Profile, User, VideoConferenceManager etc.



(2) use a tick_clock and overwrite that in test. this can't be easily

done because we have to pass the clock into each VideoConferenceUkmHelper which is implicitly created and stored in the

client; which means several steps of assignment.



Given the duration is already tested in VideoConferenceUkmHelperTest,

Here in this test we can focus more on the triggering and

bool values of the UKM log.



We can have a more complicated fix later on if required. But not in

this reland.



Original change's description:

> [VC] ukm logging for arc++ apps.

>

> (1) each vc app_id is also mapped to a ukm_helper.

>

> (2) ukm_helper records the start and stop of camera and microphone

> capturing.

>

> (3) ukm is logged when the app is closed.

>

> Bug: b/266004750

>

entry.title: Set selection bounds if needed before showing the touch selection menu.
entry.content:
On ChromeOS, tapping the caret should show an insertion handle and

toggle showing the touch selection menu. The bounds of the handle and

menu are set based on the selection bounds of the

TouchSelectionController, however, these selection bounds can be reset

between the time the caret is placed and the time the caret is tapped

again (e.g. if the mouse was moved after placing the caret). In such

cases, tapping the caret makes the menu appear at the wrong spot (top

left of the web content) and the handles don't appear.



To fix this, check if the TouchSelectionController was reset and

re-notify it of the most recently used selection bounds if needed before

showing the menu. This should ensure that the TouchSelectionController

has valid selection bounds when we try to show the handle and menu.



Bug: b:286476233

entry.title: Fix <a>'s href getter to return the attribute value for invalid URL
entry.content:
The CL is a part of the URL Interop 2023.



The anchor element 's href should return the content attribute

value as is if the invalid URL is set in its setter.



For example, Chromium fails the following test because `a.href`

returns "http://%00/#a", instead of "http://%00#a".



const a = document.createElement("a");

a.href = "http://%00#a";

assert_equals(a.href, "http://%00#a");



This behavior is non-compliant with the standard [1].



There is a WIP CL [2] which attempts to fix this issue. The difference

between the previous one and this CL is:



- The flag is now Blink's RuntimeEnabledFeature

- The flag is enabled by default. This CL doesn't add VirtualTests.



Since the flag is now enabled by default, we have to rewrite

Chromium's internal web_tests which rely on the current non-compliant

behavior.



Since `a.href` is used internally as an implementation of

canonicalize() function [3] in web_tests, we have to rewrite many

URL's canonicalization web_tests defined mostly in fast/url/.



In contrast, we don't need to rewrite any WPT tests. They are all

correct.



As discussed in the previous CL, we don't send I2S for this change.





Rebaselines:



This CL includes many rebaselines. [4] is a diff before adding

rebaselines, which might be helpful to understand the main change.



Most rebaselines are understandable. Here are some notes for the record.



a-element-origin-expected.txt:



> FAIL Parsing origin: against assert_equals: origin

> expected "null" but got ""



This is due to https://crbug.com/1416022.



The reason of PASS previously is that Chromium has two bugs which

*accidentally* made this test PASS.



Previously:



1. Chrome fails to parse against (1st issue)

2. anchor.Url() wrongly returns invalid URL as is (2nd issue)

3. anchor.origin return null for the URL.



After this CL:



1. Chrome fails to parse against (1st issue remains)

2. anchor.Url() returns null URL (after this CL)

3. anchor.origin return empty "" for null URL



Expected behavior [5]:



1. Chrome parse against successfully

2. anchor.Url() returns its URL

3. anchor.origin return null for the URL



- [1] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/links.html#dom-hyperlink-href

- [2] https://crrev.com/c/4379704

- [3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/url/resources/utilities.js

- [4] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4659525/0..8

- [5] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/links.html#dom-hyperlink-origin



Bug: 1415986

Change-Id: Id0397a66f614f32757c7d19771cd694a9ba03556

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4659525

Commit-Queue: Hayato Ito

Reviewed-by: Xiaocheng Hu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1176367}

entry.title: video-conferece:Update to autohide shelf behavior
entry.content:
Previously autohidden shelfs were shown if a VideoConferenceMediaState

update was sent, but this is not sent when apps begin capturing unless

the media state also happened to update.



Now that HandleClientUpdate was landed, we get poked when a new app

begins capturing. So respect that signal instead.

entry.title: Disable event handling while tray is hiding
entry.content:
This CL addresses an issue where you could click on the notification

center tray while it was running its hide animation, which could result

in an empty notification bubble popping up. It fixes the problem by

disabling event handling for trays while they are running their hide

animations. The event handling gets re-enabled when the hide animation

ends or is interrupted.



Fixed: b:293174118
